blockEntries.name: target
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of Cortex modules to load. The alias 'all' can be used in the list to load a number of core modules and will enable single-binary mode. Use '-modules' command line flag to get a list of available modules, and to see which modules are included in 'all'.

blockEntries.name: auth_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Set to false to disable auth.

blockEntries.name: http_prefix
blockEntries.desc: HTTP path prefix for Cortex API.

blockEntries.name: response_compression_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Use GZIP compression for API responses. Some endpoints serve large YAML or JSON blobs which can benefit from compression.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_http_prefix
blockEntries.desc: HTTP URL path under which the Alertmanager ui and api will be served.

blockEntries.name: prometheus_http_prefix
blockEntries.desc: HTTP URL path under which the Prometheus api will be served.

blockEntries.name: http_listen_network
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server listen network, default tcp

blockEntries.name: http_listen_address
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server listen address.

blockEntries.name: http_listen_port
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server listen port.

blockEntries.name: http_listen_conn_limit
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of simultaneous http connections, <=0 to disable

blockEntries.name: grpc_listen_network
blockEntries.desc: gRPC server listen network

blockEntries.name: grpc_listen_address
blockEntries.desc: gRPC server listen address.

blockEntries.name: grpc_listen_port
blockEntries.desc: gRPC server listen port.

blockEntries.name: grpc_listen_conn_limit
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of simultaneous grpc connections, <=0 to disable

blockEntries.name: cert_file
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server cert path.

blockEntries.name: key_file
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server key path.

blockEntries.name: client_auth_type
blockEntries.desc: HTTP TLS Client Auth type.

blockEntries.name: client_ca_file
blockEntries.desc: HTTP TLS Client CA path.

blockEntries.name: cert_file
blockEntries.desc: GRPC TLS server cert path.

blockEntries.name: key_file
blockEntries.desc: GRPC TLS server key path.

blockEntries.name: client_auth_type
blockEntries.desc: GRPC TLS Client Auth type.

blockEntries.name: client_ca_file
blockEntries.desc: GRPC TLS Client CA path.

blockEntries.name: register_instrumentation
blockEntries.desc: Register the intrumentation handlers (/metrics etc).

blockEntries.name: graceful_shutdown_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for graceful shutdowns

blockEntries.name: http_server_read_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Read timeout for HTTP server

blockEntries.name: http_server_write_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Write timeout for HTTP server

blockEntries.name: http_server_idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Idle timeout for HTTP server

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: Limit on the size of a gRPC message this server can receive (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: Limit on the size of a gRPC message this server can send (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_concurrent_streams
blockEntries.desc: Limit on the number of concurrent streams for gRPC calls (0 = unlimited)

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_connection_idle
blockEntries.desc: The duration after which an idle connection should be closed. Default: infinity

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_connection_age
blockEntries.desc: The duration for the maximum amount of time a connection may exist before it will be closed. Default: infinity

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_connection_age_grace
blockEntries.desc: An additive period after max-connection-age after which the connection will be forcibly closed. Default: infinity

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_keepalive_time
blockEntries.desc: Duration after which a keepalive probe is sent in case of no activity over the connection., Default: 2h

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_keepalive_timeout
blockEntries.desc: After having pinged for keepalive check, the duration after which an idle connection should be closed, Default: 20s

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_min_time_between_pings
blockEntries.desc: Minimum amount of time a client should wait before sending a keepalive ping. If client sends keepalive ping more often, server will send GOAWAY and close the connection.

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_ping_without_stream_allowed
blockEntries.desc: If true, server allows keepalive pings even when there are no active streams(RPCs). If false, and client sends ping when there are no active streams, server will send GOAWAY and close the connection.

blockEntries.name: log_format
blockEntries.desc: Output log messages in the given format. Valid formats: [logfmt, json]

blockEntries.name: log_level
blockEntries.desc: Only log messages with the given severity or above. Valid levels: [debug, info, warn, error]

blockEntries.name: log_source_ips_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Optionally log the source IPs.

blockEntries.name: log_source_ips_header
blockEntries.desc: Header field storing the source IPs. Only used if server.log-source-ips-enabled is true. If not set the default Forwarded, X-Real-IP and X-Forwarded-For headers are used

blockEntries.name: log_source_ips_regex
blockEntries.desc: Regex for matching the source IPs. Only used if server.log-source-ips-enabled is true. If not set the default Forwarded, X-Real-IP and X-Forwarded-For headers are used

blockEntries.name: http_path_prefix
blockEntries.desc: Base path to serve all API routes from (e.g. /v1/)

blockEntries.name: client_cleanup_period
blockEntries.desc: How frequently to clean up clients for ingesters that have gone away.

blockEntries.name: health_check_ingesters
blockEntries.desc: Run a health check on each ingester client during periodic cleanup.

blockEntries.name: enable_ha_tracker
blockEntries.desc: Enable the distributors HA tracker so that it can accept samples from Prometheus HA replicas gracefully (requires labels).

blockEntries.name: ha_tracker_update_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Update the timestamp in the KV store for a given cluster/replica only after this amount of time has passed since the current stored timestamp.

blockEntries.name: ha_tracker_update_timeout_jitter_max
blockEntries.desc: Maximum jitter applied to the update timeout, in order to spread the HA heartbeats over time.

blockEntries.name: ha_tracker_failover_timeout
blockEntries.desc: If we don't receive any samples from the accepted replica for a cluster in this amount of time we will failover to the next replica we receive a sample from. This value must be greater than the update timeout

blockEntries.name: store
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

blockEntries.name: prefix
blockEntries.desc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

blockEntries.name: host
blockEntries.desc: Hostname and port of Consul.

blockEntries.name: acl_token
blockEntries.desc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

blockEntries.name: http_client_timeout
blockEntries.desc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

blockEntries.name: consistent_reads
blockEntries.desc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

blockEntries.name: watch_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

blockEntries.name: watch_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

blockEntries.name: endpoints
blockEntries.desc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: Etcd username.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Etcd password.

blockEntries.name: primary
blockEntries.desc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: remote_write API max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: remote_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for downstream ingesters.

blockEntries.name: extra_queue_delay
blockEntries.desc: Time to wait before sending more than the minimum successful query requests.

blockEntries.name: sharding_strategy
blockEntries.desc: The sharding strategy to use. Supported values are: default, shuffle-sharding.

blockEntries.name: shard_by_all_labels
blockEntries.desc: Distribute samples based on all labels, as opposed to solely by user and metric name.

blockEntries.name: extend_writes
blockEntries.desc: Try writing to an additional ingester in the presence of an ingester not in the ACTIVE state. It is useful to disable this along with -ingester.unregister-on-shutdown=false in order to not spread samples to extra ingesters during rolling restarts with consistent naming.

blockEntries.name: store
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

blockEntries.name: prefix
blockEntries.desc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

blockEntries.name: host
blockEntries.desc: Hostname and port of Consul.

blockEntries.name: acl_token
blockEntries.desc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

blockEntries.name: http_client_timeout
blockEntries.desc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

blockEntries.name: consistent_reads
blockEntries.desc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

blockEntries.name: watch_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

blockEntries.name: watch_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

blockEntries.name: endpoints
blockEntries.desc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: Etcd username.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Etcd password.

blockEntries.name: primary
blockEntries.desc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_period
blockEntries.desc: Period at which to heartbeat to the ring. 0 = disabled.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The heartbeat timeout after which distributors are considered unhealthy within the ring. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

blockEntries.name: instance_id
blockEntries.desc: Instance ID to register in the ring.

blockEntries.name: instance_interface_names
blockEntries.desc: Name of network interface to read address from.

blockEntries.name: instance_port
blockEntries.desc: Port to advertise in the ring (defaults to server.grpc-listen-port).

blockEntries.name: instance_addr
blockEntries.desc: IP address to advertise in the ring.

blockEntries.name: max_ingestion_rate
blockEntries.desc: Max ingestion rate (samples/sec) that this distributor will accept. This limit is per-distributor, not per-tenant. Additional push requests will be rejected. Current ingestion rate is computed as exponentially weighted moving average, updated every second. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_inflight_push_requests
blockEntries.desc: Max inflight push requests that this distributor can handle. This limit is per-distributor, not per-tenant. Additional requests will be rejected. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_concurrent
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent queries.

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: The timeout for a query.

blockEntries.name: iterators
blockEntries.desc: Use iterators to execute query, as opposed to fully materialising the series in memory.

blockEntries.name: batch_iterators
blockEntries.desc: Use batch iterators to execute query, as opposed to fully materialising the series in memory.  Takes precedent over the -querier.iterators flag.

blockEntries.name: ingester_streaming
blockEntries.desc: Use streaming RPCs to query ingester.

blockEntries.name: max_samples
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of samples a single query can load into memory.

blockEntries.name: query_ingesters_within
blockEntries.desc: Maximum lookback beyond which queries are not sent to ingester. 0 means all queries are sent to ingester.

blockEntries.name: query_store_for_labels_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Query long-term store for series, label values and label names APIs. Works only with blocks engine.

blockEntries.name: at_modifier_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable the @ modifier in PromQL.

blockEntries.name: query_store_after
blockEntries.desc: The time after which a metric should be queried from storage and not just ingesters. 0 means all queries are sent to store. When running the blocks storage, if this option is enabled, the time range of the query sent to the store will be manipulated to ensure the query end is not more recent than 'now - query-store-after'.

blockEntries.name: max_query_into_future
blockEntries.desc: Maximum duration into the future you can query. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: default_evaluation_interval
blockEntries.desc: The default evaluation interval or step size for subqueries.

blockEntries.name: active_query_tracker_dir
blockEntries.desc: Active query tracker monitors active queries, and writes them to the file in given directory. If Cortex discovers any queries in this log during startup, it will log them to the log file. Setting to empty value disables active query tracker, which also disables -querier.max-concurrent option.

blockEntries.name: lookback_delta
blockEntries.desc: Time since the last sample after which a time series is considered stale and ignored by expression evaluations.

blockEntries.name: store_gateway_addresses
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of store-gateway addresses in DNS Service Discovery format. This option should be set when using the blocks storage and the store-gateway sharding is disabled (when enabled, the store-gateway instances form a ring and addresses are picked from the ring).

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS for gRPC client connecting to store-gateway.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: second_store_engine
blockEntries.desc: Second store engine to use for querying. Empty = disabled.

blockEntries.name: use_second_store_before_time
blockEntries.desc: If specified, second store is only used for queries before this timestamp. Default value 0 means secondary store is always queried.

blockEntries.name: shuffle_sharding_ingesters_lookback_period
blockEntries.desc: When distributor's sharding strategy is shuffle-sharding and this setting is > 0, queriers fetch in-memory series from the minimum set of required ingesters, selecting only ingesters which may have received series since 'now - lookback period'. The lookback period should be greater or equal than the configured 'query store after' and 'query ingesters within'. If this setting is 0, queriers always query all ingesters (ingesters shuffle sharding on read path is disabled).

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_compression
blockEntries.desc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: 'gzip', 'snappy' and '' (disable compression)

blockEntries.name: rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: rate_limit_burst
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

blockEntries.name: backoff_on_ratelimits
blockEntries.desc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit ratelimits.

blockEntries.name: min_period
blockEntries.desc: Minimum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_period
blockEntries.desc: Maximum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS in the GRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: wal_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable writing of ingested data into WAL.

blockEntries.name: checkpoint_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable checkpointing of in-memory chunks. It should always be true when using normally. Set it to false iff you are doing some small tests as there is no mechanism to delete the old WAL yet if checkpoint is disabled.

blockEntries.name: recover_from_wal
blockEntries.desc: Recover data from existing WAL irrespective of WAL enabled/disabled.

blockEntries.name: wal_dir
blockEntries.desc: Directory to store the WAL and/or recover from WAL.

blockEntries.name: checkpoint_duration
blockEntries.desc: Interval at which checkpoints should be created.

blockEntries.name: flush_on_shutdown_with_wal_enabled
blockEntries.desc: When WAL is enabled, should chunks be flushed to long-term storage on shutdown. Useful eg. for migration to blocks engine.

blockEntries.name: store
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

blockEntries.name: prefix
blockEntries.desc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

blockEntries.name: host
blockEntries.desc: Hostname and port of Consul.

blockEntries.name: acl_token
blockEntries.desc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

blockEntries.name: http_client_timeout
blockEntries.desc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

blockEntries.name: consistent_reads
blockEntries.desc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

blockEntries.name: watch_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

blockEntries.name: watch_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

blockEntries.name: endpoints
blockEntries.desc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: Etcd username.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Etcd password.

blockEntries.name: primary
blockEntries.desc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The heartbeat timeout after which ingesters are skipped for reads/writes. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

blockEntries.name: replication_factor
blockEntries.desc: The number of ingesters to write to and read from.

blockEntries.name: zone_awareness_enabled
blockEntries.desc: True to enable the zone-awareness and replicate ingested samples across different availability zones.

blockEntries.name: num_tokens
blockEntries.desc: Number of tokens for each ingester.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_period
blockEntries.desc: Period at which to heartbeat to consul. 0 = disabled.

blockEntries.name: observe_period
blockEntries.desc: Observe tokens after generating to resolve collisions. Useful when using gossiping ring.

blockEntries.name: join_after
blockEntries.desc: Period to wait for a claim from another member; will join automatically after this.

blockEntries.name: min_ready_duration
blockEntries.desc: Minimum duration to wait before becoming ready. This is to work around race conditions with ingesters exiting and updating the ring.

blockEntries.name: interface_names
blockEntries.desc: Name of network interface to read address from.

blockEntries.name: final_sleep
blockEntries.desc: Duration to sleep for before exiting, to ensure metrics are scraped.

blockEntries.name: tokens_file_path
blockEntries.desc: File path where tokens are stored. If empty, tokens are not stored at shutdown and restored at startup.

blockEntries.name: availability_zone
blockEntries.desc: The availability zone where this instance is running.

blockEntries.name: unregister_on_shutdown
blockEntries.desc: Unregister from the ring upon clean shutdown. It can be useful to disable for rolling restarts with consistent naming in conjunction with -distributor.extend-writes=false.

blockEntries.name: address
blockEntries.desc: IP address to advertise in the ring.

blockEntries.name: max_transfer_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of times to try and transfer chunks before falling back to flushing. Negative value or zero disables hand-over. This feature is supported only by the chunks storage.

blockEntries.name: flush_period
blockEntries.desc: Period with which to attempt to flush chunks.

blockEntries.name: retain_period
blockEntries.desc: Period chunks will remain in memory after flushing.

blockEntries.name: max_chunk_idle_time
blockEntries.desc: Maximum chunk idle time before flushing.

blockEntries.name: max_stale_chunk_idle_time
blockEntries.desc: Maximum chunk idle time for chunks terminating in stale markers before flushing. 0 disables it and a stale series is not flushed until the max-chunk-idle timeout is reached.

blockEntries.name: flush_op_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for individual flush operations.

blockEntries.name: max_chunk_age
blockEntries.desc: Maximum chunk age before flushing.

blockEntries.name: chunk_age_jitter
blockEntries.desc: Range of time to subtract from -ingester.max-chunk-age to spread out flushes

blockEntries.name: concurrent_flushes
blockEntries.desc: Number of concurrent goroutines flushing to dynamodb.

blockEntries.name: spread_flushes
blockEntries.desc: If true, spread series flushes across the whole period of -ingester.max-chunk-age.

blockEntries.name: metadata_retain_period
blockEntries.desc: Period at which metadata we have not seen will remain in memory before being deleted.

blockEntries.name: rate_update_period
blockEntries.desc: Period with which to update the per-user ingestion rates.

blockEntries.name: active_series_metrics_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable tracking of active series and export them as metrics.

blockEntries.name: active_series_metrics_update_period
blockEntries.desc: How often to update active series metrics.

blockEntries.name: active_series_metrics_idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: After what time a series is considered to be inactive.

blockEntries.name: max_ingestion_rate
blockEntries.desc: Max ingestion rate (samples/sec) that ingester will accept. This limit is per-ingester, not per-tenant. Additional push requests will be rejected. Current ingestion rate is computed as exponentially weighted moving average, updated every second. This limit only works when using blocks engine. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_tenants
blockEntries.desc: Max users that this ingester can hold. Requests from additional users will be rejected. This limit only works when using blocks engine. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_series
blockEntries.desc: Max series that this ingester can hold (across all tenants). Requests to create additional series will be rejected. This limit only works when using blocks engine. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_inflight_push_requests
blockEntries.desc: Max inflight push requests that this ingester can handle (across all tenants). Additional requests will be rejected. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: ignore_series_limit_for_metric_names
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of metric names, for which -ingester.max-series-per-metric and -ingester.max-global-series-per-metric limits will be ignored. Does not affect max-series-per-user or max-global-series-per-metric limits.

blockEntries.name: wal_dir
blockEntries.desc: Directory to read WAL from (chunks storage engine only).

blockEntries.name: concurrent_flushes
blockEntries.desc: Number of concurrent goroutines flushing to storage (chunks storage engine only).

blockEntries.name: flush_op_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for individual flush operations (chunks storage engine only).

blockEntries.name: exit_after_flush
blockEntries.desc: Stop Cortex after flush has finished. If false, Cortex process will keep running, doing nothing.

blockEntries.name: engine
blockEntries.desc: The storage engine to use: chunks (deprecated) or blocks.

blockEntries.name: dynamodb_url
blockEntries.desc: DynamoDB endpoint URL with escaped Key and Secret encoded. If only region is specified as a host, proper endpoint will be deduced. Use inmemory:///<table-name> to use a mock in-memory implementation.

blockEntries.name: api_limit
blockEntries.desc: DynamoDB table management requests per second limit.

blockEntries.name: throttle_limit
blockEntries.desc: DynamoDB rate cap to back off when throttled.

blockEntries.name: url
blockEntries.desc: Use metrics-based autoscaling, via this query URL

blockEntries.name: target_queue_length
blockEntries.desc: Queue length above which we will scale up capacity

blockEntries.name: scale_up_factor
blockEntries.desc: Scale up capacity by this multiple

blockEntries.name: ignore_throttle_below
blockEntries.desc: Ignore throttling below this level (rate per second)

blockEntries.name: queue_length_query
blockEntries.desc: query to fetch ingester queue length

blockEntries.name: write_throttle_query
blockEntries.desc: query to fetch throttle rates per table

blockEntries.name: write_usage_query
blockEntries.desc: query to fetch write capacity usage per table

blockEntries.name: read_usage_query
blockEntries.desc: query to fetch read capacity usage per table

blockEntries.name: read_error_query
blockEntries.desc: query to fetch read errors per table

blockEntries.name: chunk_gang_size
blockEntries.desc: Number of chunks to group together to parallelise fetches (zero to disable)

blockEntries.name: chunk_get_max_parallelism
blockEntries.desc: Max number of chunk-get operations to start in parallel

blockEntries.name: min_period

blockEntries.desc: Maximum accepted sample age before rejecting.

blockEntries.name: creation_grace_period
blockEntries.desc: Duration which table will be created/deleted before/after it's needed; we won't accept sample from before this time.

blockEntries.name: enforce_metadata_metric_name
blockEntries.desc: Enforce every metadata has a metric name.

blockEntries.name: enforce_metric_name
blockEntries.desc: Enforce every sample has a metric name.

blockEntries.name: ingestion_tenant_shard_size
blockEntries.desc: The default tenant's shard size when the shuffle-sharding strategy is used. Must be set both on ingesters and distributors. When this setting is specified in the per-tenant overrides, a value of 0 disables shuffle sharding for the tenant.

blockEntries.name: metric_relabel_configs
blockEntries.desc: List of metric relabel configurations. Note that in most situations, it is more effective to use metrics relabeling directly in the Prometheus server, e.g. remote_write.write_relabel_configs.

blockEntries.name: max_series_per_query
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of series for which a query can fetch samples from each ingester. This limit is enforced only in the ingesters (when querying samples not flushed to the storage yet) and it's a per-instance limit. This limit is ignored when running the Cortex blocks storage. When running Cortex with blocks storage use -querier.max-fetched-series-per-query limit instead.

blockEntries.name: max_samples_per_query
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of samples that a query can return. This limit only applies when running the Cortex chunks storage with -querier.ingester-streaming=false.

blockEntries.name: max_series_per_user
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of active series per user, per ingester. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_series_per_metric
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of active series per metric name, per ingester. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_global_series_per_user
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of active series per user, across the cluster before replication. 0 to disable. Supported only if -distributor.shard-by-all-labels is true.

blockEntries.name: max_global_series_per_metric
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of active series per metric name, across the cluster before replication. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: min_chunk_length
blockEntries.desc: Minimum number of samples in an idle chunk to flush it to the store. Use with care, if chunks are less than this size they will be discarded. This option is ignored when running the Cortex blocks storage. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_metadata_per_user
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of active metrics with metadata per user, per ingester. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_metadata_per_metric
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of metadata per metric, per ingester. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_global_metadata_per_user
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of active metrics with metadata per user, across the cluster. 0 to disable. Supported only if -distributor.shard-by-all-labels is true.

blockEntries.name: max_global_metadata_per_metric
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of metadata per metric, across the cluster. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_chunks_per_query
blockEntries.desc: Deprecated. Use -querier.max-fetched-chunks-per-query CLI flag and its respective YAML config option instead. Maximum number of chunks that can be fetched in a single query. This limit is enforced when fetching chunks from the long-term storage only. When running the Cortex chunks storage, this limit is enforced in the querier and ruler, while when running the Cortex blocks storage this limit is enforced in the querier, ruler and store-gateway. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_fetched_chunks_per_query
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of chunks that can be fetched in a single query from ingesters and long-term storage. This limit is enforced in the querier, ruler and store-gateway. Takes precedence over the deprecated -store.query-chunk-limit. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_fetched_series_per_query
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of unique series for which a query can fetch samples from each ingesters and blocks storage. This limit is enforced in the querier only when running Cortex with blocks storage. 0 to disable

blockEntries.name: max_fetched_chunk_bytes_per_query
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of all chunks in bytes that a query can fetch from each ingester and storage. This limit is enforced in the querier and ruler only when running Cortex with blocks storage. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_query_lookback
blockEntries.desc: Limit how long back data (series and metadata) can be queried, up until <lookback> duration ago. This limit is enforced in the query-frontend, querier and ruler. If the requested time range is outside the allowed range, the request will not fail but will be manipulated to only query data within the allowed time range. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_query_length
blockEntries.desc: Limit the query time range (end - start time). This limit is enforced in the query-frontend (on the received query), in the querier (on the query possibly split by the query-frontend) and in the chunks storage. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_query_parallelism
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of split queries will be scheduled in parallel by the frontend.

blockEntries.name: cardinality_limit
blockEntries.desc: Cardinality limit for index queries. This limit is ignored when running the Cortex blocks storage. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_cache_freshness
blockEntries.desc: Most recent allowed cacheable result per-tenant, to prevent caching very recent results that might still be in flux.

blockEntries.name: max_queriers_per_tenant
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of queriers that can handle requests for a single tenant. If set to 0 or value higher than number of available queriers, *all* queriers will handle requests for the tenant. Each frontend (or query-scheduler, if used) will select the same set of queriers for the same tenant (given that all queriers are connected to all frontends / query-schedulers). This option only works with queriers connecting to the query-frontend / query-scheduler, not when using downstream URL.

blockEntries.name: ruler_evaluation_delay_duration
blockEntries.desc: Duration to delay the evaluation of rules to ensure the underlying metrics have been pushed to Cortex.

blockEntries.name: ruler_tenant_shard_size
blockEntries.desc: The default tenant's shard size when the shuffle-sharding strategy is used by ruler. When this setting is specified in the per-tenant overrides, a value of 0 disables shuffle sharding for the tenant.

blockEntries.name: ruler_max_rules_per_rule_group
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of rules per rule group per-tenant. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: ruler_max_rule_groups_per_tenant
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of rule groups per-tenant. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: store_gateway_tenant_shard_size
blockEntries.desc: The default tenant's shard size when the shuffle-sharding strategy is used. Must be set when the store-gateway sharding is enabled with the shuffle-sharding strategy. When this setting is specified in the per-tenant overrides, a value of 0 disables shuffle sharding for the tenant.

blockEntries.name: compactor_blocks_retention_period
blockEntries.desc: Delete blocks containing samples older than the specified retention period. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: s3_sse_type
blockEntries.desc: S3 server-side encryption type. Required to enable server-side encryption overrides for a specific tenant. If not set, the default S3 client settings are used.

blockEntries.name: s3_sse_kms_key_id
blockEntries.desc: S3 server-side encryption KMS Key ID. Ignored if the SSE type override is not set.

blockEntries.name: s3_sse_kms_encryption_context
blockEntries.desc: S3 server-side encryption KMS encryption context. If unset and the key ID override is set, the encryption context will not be provided to S3. Ignored if the SSE type override is not set.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_receivers_firewall_block_cidr_networks
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of network CIDRs to block in Alertmanager receiver integrations.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_receivers_firewall_block_private_addresses
blockEntries.desc: True to block private and local addresses in Alertmanager receiver integrations. It blocks private addresses defined by  RFC 1918 (IPv4 addresses) and RFC 4193 (IPv6 addresses), as well as loopback, local unicast and local multicast addresses.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_notification_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Per-user rate limit for sending notifications from Alertmanager in notifications/sec. 0 = rate limit disabled. Negative value = no notifications are allowed.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_notification_rate_limit_per_integration
blockEntries.desc: Per-integration notification rate limits. Value is a map, where each key is integration name and value is a rate-limit (float). On command line, this map is given in JSON format. Rate limit has the same meaning as -alertmanager.notification-rate-limit, but only applies for specific integration. Allowed integration names: webhook, email, pagerduty, opsgenie, wechat, slack, victorops, pushover, sns.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_config_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of configuration file for Alertmanager that tenant can upload via Alertmanager API. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_templates_count
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of templates in tenant's Alertmanager configuration uploaded via Alertmanager API. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_template_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of single template in tenant's Alertmanager configuration uploaded via Alertmanager API. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_dispatcher_aggregation_groups
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of aggregation groups in Alertmanager's dispatcher that a tenant can have. Each active aggregation group uses single goroutine. When the limit is reached, dispatcher will not dispatch alerts that belong to additional aggregation groups, but existing groups will keep working properly. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_alerts_count
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of alerts that a single user can have. Inserting more alerts will fail with a log message and metric increment. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_alerts_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum total size of alerts that a single user can have, alert size is the sum of the bytes of its labels, annotations and generatorURL. Inserting more alerts will fail with a log message and metric increment. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: frontend_address
blockEntries.desc: Address of query frontend service, in host:port format. If -querier.scheduler-address is set as well, querier will use scheduler instead. Only one of -querier.frontend-address or -querier.scheduler-address can be set. If neither is set, queries are only received via HTTP endpoint.

blockEntries.name: scheduler_address
blockEntries.desc: Hostname (and port) of scheduler that querier will periodically resolve, connect to and receive queries from. Only one of -querier.frontend-address or -querier.scheduler-address can be set. If neither is set, queries are only received via HTTP endpoint.

blockEntries.name: dns_lookup_duration
blockEntries.desc: How often to query DNS for query-frontend or query-scheduler address.

blockEntries.name: parallelism
blockEntries.desc: Number of simultaneous queries to process per query-frontend or query-scheduler.

blockEntries.name: match_max_concurrent
blockEntries.desc: Force worker concurrency to match the -querier.max-concurrent option. Overrides querier.worker-parallelism.

blockEntries.name: id
blockEntries.desc: Querier ID, sent to frontend service to identify requests from the same querier. Defaults to hostname.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_compression
blockEntries.desc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: 'gzip', 'snappy' and '' (disable compression)

blockEntries.name: rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: rate_limit_burst
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

blockEntries.name: backoff_on_ratelimits
blockEntries.desc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit ratelimits.

blockEntries.name: min_period
blockEntries.desc: Minimum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_period
blockEntries.desc: Maximum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS in the GRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: log_queries_longer_than
blockEntries.desc: Log queries that are slower than the specified duration. Set to 0 to disable. Set to < 0 to enable on all queries.

blockEntries.name: max_body_size
blockEntries.desc: Max body size for downstream prometheus.

blockEntries.name: query_stats_enabled
blockEntries.desc: True to enable query statistics tracking. When enabled, a message with some statistics is logged for every query.

blockEntries.name: max_outstanding_per_tenant
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of outstanding requests per tenant per frontend; requests beyond this error with HTTP 429.

blockEntries.name: querier_forget_delay
blockEntries.desc: If a querier disconnects without sending notification about graceful shutdown, the query-frontend will keep the querier in the tenant's shard until the forget delay has passed. This feature is useful to reduce the blast radius when shuffle-sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: scheduler_address
blockEntries.desc: DNS hostname used for finding query-schedulers.

blockEntries.name: scheduler_dns_lookup_period
blockEntries.desc: How often to resolve the scheduler-address, in order to look for new query-scheduler instances.

blockEntries.name: scheduler_worker_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of concurrent workers forwarding queries to single query-scheduler.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_compression
blockEntries.desc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: 'gzip', 'snappy' and '' (disable compression)

blockEntries.name: rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: rate_limit_burst
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

blockEntries.name: backoff_on_ratelimits
blockEntries.desc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit ratelimits.

blockEntries.name: min_period
blockEntries.desc: Minimum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_period
blockEntries.desc: Maximum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS in the GRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: instance_interface_names
blockEntries.desc: Name of network interface to read address from. This address is sent to query-scheduler and querier, which uses it to send the query response back to query-frontend.

blockEntries.name: address
blockEntries.desc: IP address to advertise to querier (via scheduler) (resolved via interfaces by default).

blockEntries.name: downstream_url
blockEntries.desc: URL of downstream Prometheus.

blockEntries.name: split_queries_by_interval
blockEntries.desc: Split queries by an interval and execute in parallel, 0 disables it. You should use an a multiple of 24 hours (same as the storage bucketing scheme), to avoid queriers downloading and processing the same chunks. This also determines how cache keys are chosen when result caching is enabled

blockEntries.name: align_queries_with_step
blockEntries.desc: Mutate incoming queries to align their start and end with their step.

blockEntries.name: enable_fifocache
blockEntries.desc: Enable in-memory cache.

blockEntries.name: default_validity
blockEntries.desc: The default validity of entries for caches unless overridden.

blockEntries.name: writeback_goroutines
blockEntries.desc: At what concurrency to write back to cache.

blockEntries.name: writeback_buffer
blockEntries.desc: How many key batches to buffer for background write-back.

blockEntries.name: expiration
blockEntries.desc: How long keys stay in the memcache.

blockEntries.name: batch_size
blockEntries.desc: How many keys to fetch in each batch.

blockEntries.name: parallelism
blockEntries.desc: Maximum active requests to memcache.

blockEntries.name: host
blockEntries.desc: Hostname for memcached service to use. If empty and if addresses is unset, no memcached will be used.

blockEntries.name: service
blockEntries.desc: SRV service used to discover memcache servers.

blockEntries.name: addresses
blockEntries.desc: EXPERIMENTAL: Comma separated addresses list in DNS Service Discovery format: https://cortexmetrics.io/docs/configuration/arguments/#dns-service-discovery

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: Maximum time to wait before giving up on memcached requests.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_conns
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of idle connections in pool.

blockEntries.name: max_item_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of an item stored in memcached. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

blockEntries.name: update_interval
blockEntries.desc: Period with which to poll DNS for memcache servers.

blockEntries.name: consistent_hash
blockEntries.desc: Use consistent hashing to distribute to memcache servers.

blockEntries.name: circuit_breaker_consecutive_failures
blockEntries.desc: Trip circuit-breaker after this number of consecutive dial failures (if zero then circuit-breaker is disabled).

blockEntries.name: circuit_breaker_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Duration circuit-breaker remains open after tripping (if zero then 60 seconds is used).

blockEntries.name: circuit_breaker_interval
blockEntries.desc: Reset circuit-breaker counts after this long (if zero then never reset).

blockEntries.name: endpoint
blockEntries.desc: Redis Server endpoint to use for caching. A comma-separated list of endpoints for Redis Cluster or Redis Sentinel. If empty, no redis will be used.

blockEntries.name: master_name
blockEntries.desc: Redis Sentinel master name. An empty string for Redis Server or Redis Cluster.

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: Maximum time to wait before giving up on redis requests.

blockEntries.name: expiration
blockEntries.desc: How long keys stay in the redis.

blockEntries.name: db
blockEntries.desc: Database index.

blockEntries.name: pool_size
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of connections in the pool.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Password to use when connecting to redis.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable connecting to redis with TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Close connections after remaining idle for this duration. If the value is zero, then idle connections are not closed.

blockEntries.name: max_connection_age
blockEntries.desc: Close connections older than this duration. If the value is zero, then the pool does not close connections based on age.

blockEntries.name: max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum memory size of the cache in bytes. A unit suffix (KB, MB, GB) may be applied.

blockEntries.name: max_size_items
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of entries in the cache.

blockEntries.name: validity
blockEntries.desc: The expiry duration for the cache.

blockEntries.name: size
blockEntries.desc: Deprecated (use max-size-items or max-size-bytes instead): The number of entries to cache.

blockEntries.name: compression
blockEntries.desc: Use compression in results cache. Supported values are: 'snappy' and '' (disable compression).

blockEntries.name: cache_results
blockEntries.desc: Cache query results.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of retries for a single request; beyond this, the downstream error is returned.

blockEntries.name: parallelise_shardable_queries
blockEntries.desc: Perform query parallelisations based on storage sharding configuration and query ASTs. This feature is supported only by the chunks storage engine.

blockEntries.name: throughput_updates_disabled
blockEntries.desc: If true, disable all changes to DB capacity

blockEntries.name: retention_deletes_enabled
blockEntries.desc: If true, enables retention deletes of DB tables

blockEntries.name: retention_period
blockEntries.desc: Tables older than this retention period are deleted. Must be either 0 (disabled) or a multiple of 24h. When enabled, be aware this setting is destructive to data!

blockEntries.name: poll_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently to poll backend to learn our capacity.

blockEntries.name: creation_grace_period
blockEntries.desc: Periodic tables grace period (duration which table will be created/deleted before/after it's needed).

blockEntries.name: enable_ondemand_throughput_mode
blockEntries.desc: Enables on demand throughput provisioning for the storage provider (if supported). Applies only to tables which are not autoscaled. Supported by DynamoDB

blockEntries.name: provisioned_write_throughput
blockEntries.desc: Table default write throughput. Supported by DynamoDB

blockEntries.name: provisioned_read_throughput
blockEntries.desc: Table default read throughput. Supported by DynamoDB

blockEntries.name: enabled
blockEntries.desc: Should we enable autoscale for the table.

blockEntries.name: role_arn
blockEntries.desc: AWS AutoScaling role ARN

blockEntries.name: min_capacity
blockEntries.desc: DynamoDB minimum provision capacity.

blockEntries.name: max_capacity
blockEntries.desc: DynamoDB maximum provision capacity.

blockEntries.name: out_cooldown
blockEntries.desc: DynamoDB minimum seconds between each autoscale up.

blockEntries.name: in_cooldown
blockEntries.desc: DynamoDB minimum seconds between each autoscale down.

blockEntries.name: target
blockEntries.desc: DynamoDB target ratio of consumed capacity to provisioned capacity.
