blockEntries.name: inactive_write_scale_lastn
blockEntries.desc: Number of last inactive tables to enable write autoscale.

blockEntries.name: inactive_read_scale_lastn
blockEntries.desc: Number of last inactive tables to enable read autoscale.

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use. Supported backends are: s3, gcs, azure, swift, filesystem.

blockEntries.name: endpoint
blockEntries.desc: The S3 bucket endpoint. It could be an AWS S3 endpoint listed at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/s3.html or the address of an S3-compatible service in hostname:port format.

blockEntries.name: region
blockEntries.desc: S3 region. If unset, the client will issue a S3 GetBucketLocation API call to autodetect it.

blockEntries.name: bucket_name
blockEntries.desc: S3 bucket name

blockEntries.name: secret_access_key
blockEntries.desc: S3 secret access key

blockEntries.name: access_key_id
blockEntries.desc: S3 access key ID

blockEntries.name: insecure
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, use http:// for the S3 endpoint instead of https://. This could be useful in local dev/test environments while using an S3-compatible backend storage, like Minio.

blockEntries.name: signature_version
blockEntries.desc: The signature version to use for authenticating against S3. Supported values are: v4, v2.

blockEntries.name: type
blockEntries.desc: Enable AWS Server Side Encryption. Supported values: SSE-KMS, SSE-S3.

blockEntries.name: kms_key_id
blockEntries.desc: KMS Key ID used to encrypt objects in S3

blockEntries.name: kms_encryption_context
blockEntries.desc: KMS Encryption Context used for object encryption. It expects JSON formatted string.

blockEntries.name: idle_conn_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The time an idle connection will remain idle before closing.

blockEntries.name: response_header_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The amount of time the client will wait for a servers response headers.

blockEntries.name: insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: If the client connects to S3 via HTTPS and this option is enabled, the client will accept any certificate and hostname.

blockEntries.name: tls_handshake_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Maximum time to wait for a TLS handshake. 0 means no limit.

blockEntries.name: expect_continue_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The time to wait for a server's first response headers after fully writing the request headers if the request has an Expect header. 0 to send the request body immediately.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections across all hosts. 0 means no limit.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections_per_host
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections to keep per-host. If 0, a built-in default value is used.

blockEntries.name: max_connections_per_host
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of connections per host. 0 means no limit.

blockEntries.name: bucket_name
blockEntries.desc: GCS bucket name

blockEntries.name: service_account
blockEntries.desc: JSON representing either a Google Developers Console client_credentials.json file or a Google Developers service account key file. If empty, fallback to Google default logic.

blockEntries.name: account_name
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage account name

blockEntries.name: account_key
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage account key

blockEntries.name: container_name
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage container name

blockEntries.name: endpoint_suffix
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage endpoint suffix without schema. The account name will be prefixed to this value to create the FQDN

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of retries for recoverable errors

blockEntries.name: auth_version
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift authentication API version. 0 to autodetect.

blockEntries.name: auth_url
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift authentication URL

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift username.

blockEntries.name: user_domain_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.

blockEntries.name: user_domain_id
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

blockEntries.name: user_id
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user ID.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift API key.

blockEntries.name: domain_id
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

blockEntries.name: domain_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.

blockEntries.name: project_id
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift project ID (v2,v3 auth only).

blockEntries.name: project_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift project name (v2,v3 auth only).

blockEntries.name: project_domain_id
blockEntries.desc: ID of the OpenStack Swift project's domain (v3 auth only), only needed if it differs the from user domain.

blockEntries.name: project_domain_name
blockEntries.desc: Name of the OpenStack Swift project's domain (v3 auth only), only needed if it differs from the user domain.

blockEntries.name: region_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift Region to use (v2,v3 auth only).

blockEntries.name: container_name
blockEntries.desc: Name of the OpenStack Swift container to put chunks in.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Max retries on requests error.

blockEntries.name: connect_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Time after which a connection attempt is aborted.

blockEntries.name: request_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Time after which an idle request is aborted. The timeout watchdog is reset each time some data is received, so the timeout triggers after X time no data is received on a request.

blockEntries.name: dir
blockEntries.desc: Local filesystem storage directory.

blockEntries.name: sync_dir
blockEntries.desc: Directory to store synchronized TSDB index headers.

blockEntries.name: sync_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently to scan the bucket, or to refresh the bucket index (if enabled), in order to look for changes (new blocks shipped by ingesters and blocks deleted by retention or compaction).

blockEntries.name: max_concurrent
blockEntries.desc: Max number of concurrent queries to execute against the long-term storage. The limit is shared across all tenants.

blockEntries.name: tenant_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of concurrent tenants synching blocks.

blockEntries.name: block_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of concurrent blocks synching per tenant.

blockEntries.name: meta_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of Go routines to use when syncing block meta files from object storage per tenant.

blockEntries.name: consistency_delay
blockEntries.desc: Minimum age of a block before it's being read. Set it to safe value (e.g 30m) if your object storage is eventually consistent. GCS and S3 are (roughly) strongly consistent.

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: The index cache backend type. Supported values: inmemory, memcached.

blockEntries.name: max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size in bytes of in-memory index cache used to speed up blocks index lookups (shared between all tenants).

blockEntries.name: addresses
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of memcached addresses. Supported prefixes are: dns+ (looked up as an A/AAAA query), dnssrv+ (looked up as a SRV query, dnssrvnoa+ (looked up as a SRV query, with no A/AAAA lookup made after that).

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: The socket read/write timeout.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of idle connections that will be maintained per address.

blockEntries.name: max_async_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent asynchronous operations can occur.

blockEntries.name: max_async_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of enqueued asynchronous operations allowed.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent connections running get operations. If set to 0, concurrency is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of keys a single underlying get operation should run. If more keys are specified, internally keys are split into multiple batches and fetched concurrently, honoring the max concurrency. If set to 0, the max batch size is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_item_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of an item stored in memcached. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

blockEntries.name: auto_discovery
blockEntries.desc: Use memcached auto-discovery mechanism provided by some cloud provider like GCP and AWS

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: Backend for chunks cache, if not empty. Supported values: memcached.

blockEntries.name: addresses
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of memcached addresses. Supported prefixes are: dns+ (looked up as an A/AAAA query), dnssrv+ (looked up as a SRV query, dnssrvnoa+ (looked up as a SRV query, with no A/AAAA lookup made after that).

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: The socket read/write timeout.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of idle connections that will be maintained per address.

blockEntries.name: max_async_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent asynchronous operations can occur.

blockEntries.name: max_async_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of enqueued asynchronous operations allowed.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent connections running get operations. If set to 0, concurrency is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of keys a single underlying get operation should run. If more keys are specified, internally keys are split into multiple batches and fetched concurrently, honoring the max concurrency. If set to 0, the max batch size is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_item_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of an item stored in memcached. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

blockEntries.name: auto_discovery
blockEntries.desc: Use memcached auto-discovery mechanism provided by some cloud provider like GCP and AWS

blockEntries.name: subrange_size
blockEntries.desc: Size of each subrange that bucket object is split into for better caching.

blockEntries.name: max_get_range_requests
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of sub-GetRange requests that a single GetRange request can be split into when fetching chunks. Zero or negative value = unlimited number of sub-requests.

blockEntries.name: attributes_ttl
blockEntries.desc: TTL for caching object attributes for chunks.

blockEntries.name: subrange_ttl
blockEntries.desc: TTL for caching individual chunks subranges.

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: Backend for metadata cache, if not empty. Supported values: memcached.

blockEntries.name: addresses
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of memcached addresses. Supported prefixes are: dns+ (looked up as an A/AAAA query), dnssrv+ (looked up as a SRV query, dnssrvnoa+ (looked up as a SRV query, with no A/AAAA lookup made after that).

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: The socket read/write timeout.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of idle connections that will be maintained per address.

blockEntries.name: max_async_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent asynchronous operations can occur.

blockEntries.name: max_async_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of enqueued asynchronous operations allowed.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent connections running get operations. If set to 0, concurrency is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of keys a single underlying get operation should run. If more keys are specified, internally keys are split into multiple batches and fetched concurrently, honoring the max concurrency. If set to 0, the max batch size is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_item_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of an item stored in memcached. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

blockEntries.name: auto_discovery
blockEntries.desc: Use memcached auto-discovery mechanism provided by some cloud provider like GCP and AWS

blockEntries.name: tenants_list_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache list of tenants in the bucket.

blockEntries.name: tenant_blocks_list_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache list of blocks for each tenant.

blockEntries.name: chunks_list_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache list of chunks for a block.

blockEntries.name: metafile_exists_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache information that block metafile exists. Also used for user deletion mark file.

blockEntries.name: metafile_doesnt_exist_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache information that block metafile doesn't exist. Also used for user deletion mark file.

blockEntries.name: metafile_content_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache content of the metafile.

blockEntries.name: metafile_max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of metafile content to cache in bytes. Caching will be skipped if the content exceeds this size. This is useful to avoid network round trip for large content if the configured caching backend has an hard limit on cached items size (in this case, you should set this limit to the same limit in the caching backend).

blockEntries.name: metafile_attributes_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache attributes of the block metafile.

blockEntries.name: block_index_attributes_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache attributes of the block index.

blockEntries.name: bucket_index_content_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache content of the bucket index.

blockEntries.name: bucket_index_max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of bucket index content to cache in bytes. Caching will be skipped if the content exceeds this size. This is useful to avoid network round trip for large content if the configured caching backend has an hard limit on cached items size (in this case, you should set this limit to the same limit in the caching backend).

blockEntries.name: ignore_deletion_mark_delay
blockEntries.desc: Duration after which the blocks marked for deletion will be filtered out while fetching blocks. The idea of ignore-deletion-marks-delay is to ignore blocks that are marked for deletion with some delay. This ensures store can still serve blocks that are meant to be deleted but do not have a replacement yet. Default is 6h, half of the default value for -compactor.deletion-delay.

blockEntries.name: enabled
blockEntries.desc: True to enable querier and store-gateway to discover blocks in the storage via bucket index instead of bucket scanning.

blockEntries.name: update_on_error_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently a bucket index, which previously failed to load, should be tried to load again. This option is used only by querier.

blockEntries.name: idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: How long a unused bucket index should be cached. Once this timeout expires, the unused bucket index is removed from the in-memory cache. This option is used only by querier.

blockEntries.name: max_stale_period
blockEntries.desc: The maximum allowed age of a bucket index (last updated) before queries start failing because the bucket index is too old. The bucket index is periodically updated by the compactor, while this check is enforced in the querier (at query time).

blockEntries.name: max_chunk_pool_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Max size - in bytes - of a chunks pool, used to reduce memory allocations. The pool is shared across all tenants. 0 to disable the limit.

blockEntries.name: chunk_pool_min_bucket_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Size - in bytes - of the smallest chunks pool bucket.

blockEntries.name: chunk_pool_max_bucket_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Size - in bytes - of the largest chunks pool bucket.

blockEntries.name: index_header_lazy_loading_enabled
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, store-gateway will lazy load an index-header only once required by a query.

blockEntries.name: index_header_lazy_loading_idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: If index-header lazy loading is enabled and this setting is > 0, the store-gateway will offload unused index-headers after 'idle timeout' inactivity.

blockEntries.name: partitioner_max_gap_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Max size - in bytes - of a gap for which the partitioner aggregates together two bucket GET object requests.

blockEntries.name: postings_offsets_in_mem_sampling
blockEntries.desc: Controls what is the ratio of postings offsets that the store will hold in memory.

blockEntries.name: dir
blockEntries.desc: Local directory to store TSDBs in the ingesters.

blockEntries.name: block_ranges_period
blockEntries.desc: TSDB blocks range period.

blockEntries.name: retention_period
blockEntries.desc: TSDB blocks retention in the ingester before a block is removed. This should be larger than the block_ranges_period and large enough to give store-gateways and queriers enough time to discover newly uploaded blocks.

blockEntries.name: ship_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently the TSDB blocks are scanned and new ones are shipped to the storage. 0 means shipping is disabled.

blockEntries.name: ship_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of tenants concurrently shipping blocks to the storage.

blockEntries.name: head_compaction_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently does Cortex try to compact TSDB head. Block is only created if data covers smallest block range. Must be greater than 0 and max 5 minutes.

blockEntries.name: head_compaction_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of tenants concurrently compacting TSDB head into a new block

blockEntries.name: head_compaction_idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: If TSDB head is idle for this duration, it is compacted. Note that up to 25% jitter is added to the value to avoid ingesters compacting concurrently. 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: head_chunks_write_buffer_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The write buffer size used by the head chunks mapper. Lower values reduce memory utilisation on clusters with a large number of tenants at the cost of increased disk I/O operations.

blockEntries.name: stripe_size
blockEntries.desc: The number of shards of series to use in TSDB (must be a power of 2). Reducing this will decrease memory footprint, but can negatively impact performance.

blockEntries.name: wal_compression_enabled
blockEntries.desc: True to enable TSDB WAL compression.

blockEntries.name: wal_segment_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: TSDB WAL segments files max size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: flush_blocks_on_shutdown
blockEntries.desc: True to flush blocks to storage on shutdown. If false, incomplete blocks will be reused after restart.

blockEntries.name: close_idle_tsdb_timeout
blockEntries.desc: If TSDB has not received any data for this duration, and all blocks from TSDB have been shipped, TSDB is closed and deleted from local disk. If set to positive value, this value should be equal or higher than -querier.query-ingesters-within flag to make sure that TSDB is not closed prematurely, which could cause partial query results. 0 or negative value disables closing of idle TSDB.

blockEntries.name: max_tsdb_opening_concurrency_on_startup
blockEntries.desc: limit the number of concurrently opening TSDB's on startup

blockEntries.name: max_exemplars
blockEntries.desc: Enables support for exemplars in TSDB and sets the maximum number that will be stored. 0 or less means disabled.

blockEntries.name: block_ranges
blockEntries.desc: List of compaction time ranges.

blockEntries.name: block_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of Go routines to use when syncing block index and chunks files from the long term storage.

blockEntries.name: meta_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of Go routines to use when syncing block meta files from the long term storage.

blockEntries.name: consistency_delay
blockEntries.desc: Minimum age of fresh (non-compacted) blocks before they are being processed. Malformed blocks older than the maximum of consistency-delay and 48h0m0s will be removed.

blockEntries.name: data_dir
blockEntries.desc: Data directory in which to cache blocks and process compactions

blockEntries.name: compaction_interval
blockEntries.desc: The frequency at which the compaction runs

blockEntries.name: compaction_retries
blockEntries.desc: How many times to retry a failed compaction within a single compaction run.

blockEntries.name: compaction_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Max number of concurrent compactions running.

blockEntries.name: cleanup_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently compactor should run blocks cleanup and maintenance, as well as update the bucket index.

blockEntries.name: cleanup_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Max number of tenants for which blocks cleanup and maintenance should run concurrently.

blockEntries.name: deletion_delay
blockEntries.desc: Time before a block marked for deletion is deleted from bucket. If not 0, blocks will be marked for deletion and compactor component will permanently delete blocks marked for deletion from the bucket. If 0, blocks will be deleted straight away. Note that deleting blocks immediately can cause query failures.

blockEntries.name: tenant_cleanup_delay
blockEntries.desc: For tenants marked for deletion, this is time between deleting of last block, and doing final cleanup (marker files, debug files) of the tenant.

blockEntries.name: block_deletion_marks_migration_enabled
blockEntries.desc: When enabled, at compactor startup the bucket will be scanned and all found deletion marks inside the block location will be copied to the markers global location too. This option can (and should) be safely disabled as soon as the compactor has successfully run at least once.

blockEntries.name: enabled_tenants
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of tenants that can be compacted. If specified, only these tenants will be compacted by compactor, otherwise all tenants can be compacted. Subject to sharding.

blockEntries.name: disabled_tenants
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of tenants that cannot be compacted by this compactor. If specified, and compactor would normally pick given tenant for compaction (via -compactor.enabled-tenants or sharding), it will be ignored instead.

blockEntries.name: sharding_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Shard tenants across multiple compactor instances. Sharding is required if you run multiple compactor instances, in order to coordinate compactions and avoid race conditions leading to the same tenant blocks simultaneously compacted by different instances.

blockEntries.name: store
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

blockEntries.name: prefix
blockEntries.desc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

blockEntries.name: host
blockEntries.desc: Hostname and port of Consul.

blockEntries.name: acl_token
blockEntries.desc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

blockEntries.name: http_client_timeout
blockEntries.desc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

blockEntries.name: consistent_reads
blockEntries.desc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

blockEntries.name: watch_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

blockEntries.name: watch_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

blockEntries.name: endpoints
blockEntries.desc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: Etcd username.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Etcd password.

blockEntries.name: primary
blockEntries.desc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_period
blockEntries.desc: Period at which to heartbeat to the ring. 0 = disabled.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The heartbeat timeout after which compactors are considered unhealthy within the ring. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

blockEntries.name: wait_stability_min_duration
blockEntries.desc: Minimum time to wait for ring stability at startup. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: wait_stability_max_duration
blockEntries.desc: Maximum time to wait for ring stability at startup. If the compactor ring keeps changing after this period of time, the compactor will start anyway.

blockEntries.name: instance_id
blockEntries.desc: Instance ID to register in the ring.

blockEntries.name: instance_interface_names
blockEntries.desc: Name of network interface to read address from.

blockEntries.name: instance_port
blockEntries.desc: Port to advertise in the ring (defaults to server.grpc-listen-port).

blockEntries.name: instance_addr
blockEntries.desc: IP address to advertise in the ring.

blockEntries.name: wait_active_instance_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for waiting on compactor to become ACTIVE in the ring.

blockEntries.name: sharding_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Shard blocks across multiple store gateway instances. This option needs be set both on the store-gateway and querier when running in microservices mode.

blockEntries.name: store
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

blockEntries.name: prefix
blockEntries.desc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

blockEntries.name: host
blockEntries.desc: Hostname and port of Consul.

blockEntries.name: acl_token
blockEntries.desc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

blockEntries.name: http_client_timeout
blockEntries.desc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

blockEntries.name: consistent_reads
blockEntries.desc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

blockEntries.name: watch_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

blockEntries.name: watch_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

blockEntries.name: endpoints
blockEntries.desc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: Etcd username.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Etcd password.

blockEntries.name: primary
blockEntries.desc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_period
blockEntries.desc: Period at which to heartbeat to the ring. 0 = disabled.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The heartbeat timeout after which store gateways are considered unhealthy within the ring. 0 = never (timeout disabled). This option needs be set both on the store-gateway and querier when running in microservices mode.

blockEntries.name: replication_factor
blockEntries.desc: The replication factor to use when sharding blocks. This option needs be set both on the store-gateway and querier when running in microservices mode.

blockEntries.name: tokens_file_path
blockEntries.desc: File path where tokens are stored. If empty, tokens are not stored at shutdown and restored at startup.

blockEntries.name: zone_awareness_enabled
blockEntries.desc: True to enable zone-awareness and replicate blocks across different availability zones.

blockEntries.name: wait_stability_min_duration
blockEntries.desc: Minimum time to wait for ring stability at startup. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: wait_stability_max_duration
blockEntries.desc: Maximum time to wait for ring stability at startup. If the store-gateway ring keeps changing after this period of time, the store-gateway will start anyway.

blockEntries.name: instance_id
blockEntries.desc: Instance ID to register in the ring.

blockEntries.name: instance_interface_names
blockEntries.desc: Name of network interface to read address from.

blockEntries.name: instance_port
blockEntries.desc: Port to advertise in the ring (defaults to server.grpc-listen-port).

blockEntries.name: instance_addr
blockEntries.desc: IP address to advertise in the ring.

blockEntries.name: instance_availability_zone
blockEntries.desc: The availability zone where this instance is running. Required if zone-awareness is enabled.

blockEntries.name: sharding_strategy
blockEntries.desc: The sharding strategy to use. Supported values are: default, shuffle-sharding.

blockEntries.name: enable

blockEntries.desc: Number of buffers used to used to upload a chunk.

blockEntries.name: request_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for requests made against azure blob storage.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of retries for a request which times out.

blockEntries.name: min_retry_delay
blockEntries.desc: Minimum time to wait before retrying a request.

blockEntries.name: max_retry_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum time to wait before retrying a request.

blockEntries.name: bucket_name
blockEntries.desc: Name of GCS bucket. Please refer to https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication/production for more information about how to configure authentication.

blockEntries.name: chunk_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: The size of the buffer that GCS client for each PUT request. 0 to disable buffering.

blockEntries.name: request_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The duration after which the requests to GCS should be timed out.

blockEntries.name: enable_opencensus
blockEntries.desc: Enabled OpenCensus (OC) instrumentation for all requests.

blockEntries.name: s3
blockEntries.desc: S3 endpoint URL with escaped Key and Secret encoded. If only region is specified as a host, proper endpoint will be deduced. Use inmemory:///<bucket-name> to use a mock in-memory implementation.

blockEntries.name: s3forcepathstyle
blockEntries.desc: Set this to `true` to force the request to use path-style addressing.

blockEntries.name: bucketnames
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of bucket names to evenly distribute chunks over. Overrides any buckets specified in s3.url flag

blockEntries.name: endpoint
blockEntries.desc: S3 Endpoint to connect to.

blockEntries.name: region
blockEntries.desc: AWS region to use.

blockEntries.name: access_key_id
blockEntries.desc: AWS Access Key ID

blockEntries.name: secret_access_key
blockEntries.desc: AWS Secret Access Key

blockEntries.name: insecure
blockEntries.desc: Disable https on s3 connection.

blockEntries.name: sse_encryption
blockEntries.desc: Enable AWS Server Side Encryption [Deprecated: Use .sse instead. if s3.sse-encryption is enabled, it assumes .sse.type SSE-S3]

blockEntries.name: idle_conn_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The maximum amount of time an idle connection will be held open.

blockEntries.name: response_header_timeout
blockEntries.desc: If non-zero, specifies the amount of time to wait for a server's response headers after fully writing the request.

blockEntries.name: insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Set to false to skip verifying the certificate chain and hostname.

blockEntries.name: signature_version
blockEntries.desc: The signature version to use for authenticating against S3. Supported values are: v4, v2.

blockEntries.name: type
blockEntries.desc: Enable AWS Server Side Encryption. Supported values: SSE-KMS, SSE-S3.

blockEntries.name: kms_key_id
blockEntries.desc: KMS Key ID used to encrypt objects in S3

blockEntries.name: kms_encryption_context
blockEntries.desc: KMS Encryption Context used for object encryption. It expects JSON formatted string.

blockEntries.name: path
blockEntries.desc: Path at which alertmanager configurations are stored.

blockEntries.name: listen_address
blockEntries.desc: Listen address and port for the cluster. Not specifying this flag disables high-availability mode.

blockEntries.name: advertise_address
blockEntries.desc: Explicit address or hostname to advertise in cluster.

blockEntries.name: peers
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of initial peers.

blockEntries.name: peer_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Time to wait between peers to send notifications.

blockEntries.name: gossip_interval
blockEntries.desc: The interval between sending gossip messages. By lowering this value (more frequent) gossip messages are propagated across cluster more quickly at the expense of increased bandwidth usage.

blockEntries.name: push_pull_interval
blockEntries.desc: The interval between gossip state syncs. Setting this interval lower (more frequent) will increase convergence speeds across larger clusters at the expense of increased bandwidth usage.

blockEntries.name: enable_api
blockEntries.desc: Enable the experimental alertmanager config api.

blockEntries.name: remote_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for downstream alertmanagers.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS in the GRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: persist_interval
blockEntries.desc: The interval between persisting the current alertmanager state (notification log and silences) to object storage. This is only used when sharding is enabled. This state is read when all replicas for a shard can not be contacted. In this scenario, having persisted the state more frequently will result in potentially fewer lost silences, and fewer duplicate notifications.

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use. Supported backends are: s3, gcs, azure, swift, filesystem, configdb, local.

blockEntries.name: endpoint
blockEntries.desc: The S3 bucket endpoint. It could be an AWS S3 endpoint listed at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/s3.html or the address of an S3-compatible service in hostname:port format.

blockEntries.name: region
blockEntries.desc: S3 region. If unset, the client will issue a S3 GetBucketLocation API call to autodetect it.

blockEntries.name: bucket_name
blockEntries.desc: S3 bucket name

blockEntries.name: secret_access_key
blockEntries.desc: S3 secret access key

blockEntries.name: access_key_id
blockEntries.desc: S3 access key ID

blockEntries.name: insecure
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, use http:// for the S3 endpoint instead of https://. This could be useful in local dev/test environments while using an S3-compatible backend storage, like Minio.

blockEntries.name: signature_version
blockEntries.desc: The signature version to use for authenticating against S3. Supported values are: v4, v2.

blockEntries.name: type
blockEntries.desc: Enable AWS Server Side Encryption. Supported values: SSE-KMS, SSE-S3.

blockEntries.name: kms_key_id
blockEntries.desc: KMS Key ID used to encrypt objects in S3

blockEntries.name: kms_encryption_context
blockEntries.desc: KMS Encryption Context used for object encryption. It expects JSON formatted string.

blockEntries.name: idle_conn_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The time an idle connection will remain idle before closing.

blockEntries.name: response_header_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The amount of time the client will wait for a servers response headers.

blockEntries.name: insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: If the client connects to S3 via HTTPS and this option is enabled, the client will accept any certificate and hostname.

blockEntries.name: tls_handshake_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Maximum time to wait for a TLS handshake. 0 means no limit.

blockEntries.name: expect_continue_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The time to wait for a server's first response headers after fully writing the request headers if the request has an Expect header. 0 to send the request body immediately.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections across all hosts. 0 means no limit.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections_per_host
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections to keep per-host. If 0, a built-in default value is used.

blockEntries.name: max_connections_per_host
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of connections per host. 0 means no limit.

blockEntries.name: bucket_name
blockEntries.desc: GCS bucket name

blockEntries.name: service_account
blockEntries.desc: JSON representing either a Google Developers Console client_credentials.json file or a Google Developers service account key file. If empty, fallback to Google default logic.

blockEntries.name: account_name
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage account name

blockEntries.name: account_key
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage account key

blockEntries.name: container_name
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage container name

blockEntries.name: endpoint_suffix
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage endpoint suffix without schema. The account name will be prefixed to this value to create the FQDN

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of retries for recoverable errors

blockEntries.name: auth_version
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift authentication API version. 0 to autodetect.

blockEntries.name: auth_url
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift authentication URL

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift username.

blockEntries.name: user_domain_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.

blockEntries.name: user_domain_id
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

blockEntries.name: user_id
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user ID.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift API key.

blockEntries.name: domain_id
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

blockEntries.name: domain_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.

blockEntries.name: project_id
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift project ID (v2,v3 auth only).

blockEntries.name: project_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift project name (v2,v3 auth only).

blockEntries.name: project_domain_id
blockEntries.desc: ID of the OpenStack Swift project's domain (v3 auth only), only needed if it differs the from user domain.

blockEntries.name: project_domain_name
blockEntries.desc: Name of the OpenStack Swift project's domain (v3 auth only), only needed if it differs from the user domain.

blockEntries.name: region_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift Region to use (v2,v3 auth only).

blockEntries.name: container_name
blockEntries.desc: Name of the OpenStack Swift container to put chunks in.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Max retries on requests error.

blockEntries.name: connect_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Time after which a connection attempt is aborted.

blockEntries.name: request_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Time after which an idle request is aborted. The timeout watchdog is reset each time some data is received, so the timeout triggers after X time no data is received on a request.

blockEntries.name: dir
blockEntries.desc: Local filesystem storage directory.

blockEntries.name: configs_api_url
blockEntries.desc: URL of configs API server.

blockEntries.name: client_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for requests to Weave Cloud configs service.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: path
blockEntries.desc: Path at which alertmanager configurations are stored.

blockEntries.name: period
blockEntries.desc: How often to check runtime config file.

blockEntries.name: file
blockEntries.desc: File with the configuration that can be updated in runtime.

blockEntries.name: node_name
blockEntries.desc: Name of the node in memberlist cluster. Defaults to hostname.

blockEntries.name: randomize_node_name
blockEntries.desc: Add random suffix to the node name.

blockEntries.name: stream_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The timeout for establishing a connection with a remote node, and for read/write operations.

blockEntries.name: retransmit_factor
blockEntries.desc: Multiplication factor used when sending out messages (factor * log(N+1)).

blockEntries.name: pull_push_interval
blockEntries.desc: How often to use pull/push sync.

blockEntries.name: gossip_interval
blockEntries.desc: How often to gossip.

blockEntries.name: gossip_nodes
blockEntries.desc: How many nodes to gossip to.

blockEntries.name: gossip_to_dead_nodes_time
blockEntries.desc: How long to keep gossiping to dead nodes, to give them chance to refute their death.

blockEntries.name: dead_node_reclaim_time
blockEntries.desc: How soon can dead node's name be reclaimed with new address. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: compression_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable message compression. This can be used to reduce bandwidth usage at the cost of slightly more CPU utilization.

blockEntries.name: join_members
blockEntries.desc: Other cluster members to join. Can be specified multiple times. It can be an IP, hostname or an entry specified in the DNS Service Discovery format.

blockEntries.name: min_join_backoff
blockEntries.desc: Min backoff duration to join other cluster members.

blockEntries.name: max_join_backoff
blockEntries.desc: Max backoff duration to join other cluster members.

blockEntries.name: max_join_retries
blockEntries.desc: Max number of retries to join other cluster members.

blockEntries.name: abort_if_cluster_join_fails
blockEntries.desc: If this node fails to join memberlist cluster, abort.

blockEntries.name: rejoin_interval
blockEntries.desc: If not 0, how often to rejoin the cluster. Occasional rejoin can help to fix the cluster split issue, and is harmless otherwise. For example when using only few components as a seed nodes (via -memberlist.join), then it's recommended to use rejoin. If -memberlist.join points to dynamic service that resolves to all gossiping nodes (eg. Kubernetes headless service), then rejoin is not needed.

blockEntries.name: left_ingesters_timeout
blockEntries.desc: How long to keep LEFT ingesters in the ring.

blockEntries.name: leave_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for leaving memberlist cluster.

blockEntries.name: message_history_buffer_bytes
blockEntries.desc: How much space to use for keeping received and sent messages in memory for troubleshooting (two buffers). 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: bind_addr
blockEntries.desc: IP address to listen on for gossip messages. Multiple addresses may be specified. Defaults to 0.0.0.0

blockEntries.name: bind_port
blockEntries.desc: Port to listen on for gossip messages.

blockEntries.name: packet_dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout used when connecting to other nodes to send packet.

blockEntries.name: packet_write_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for writing 'packet' data.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS on the memberlist transport layer.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: max_outstanding_requests_per_tenant
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of outstanding requests per tenant per query-scheduler. In-flight requests above this limit will fail with HTTP response status code 429.

blockEntries.name: querier_forget_delay
blockEntries.desc: If a querier disconnects without sending notification about graceful shutdown, the query-scheduler will keep the querier in the tenant's shard until the forget delay has passed. This feature is useful to reduce the blast radius when shuffle-sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_compression
blockEntries.desc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: 'gzip', 'snappy' and '' (disable compression)

blockEntries.name: rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: rate_limit_burst
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

blockEntries.name: backoff_on_ratelimits
blockEntries.desc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit ratelimits.

blockEntries.name: min_period
blockEntries.desc: Minimum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_period
blockEntries.desc: Maximum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS in the GRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate file, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key file for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates file to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.
